results.title: Crack in the curtains [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Megabeggar Productions, Anna Grieve and Jinks Dulhunty
results.brief_description: A roomful of girls share differing opinions about the motives of a peeping Tom that regularly spies on them. Their responses to how they will or won’t perform reflects the different natures of their sexuality, which they are learning about during school hours. One night they lay in wait while someone poses as bait in the window; their collective power is frightening and a definite result will be achieved. Cast includes Kaarin Fairfax, Danielle Spencer and Angie Regia.

results.title: Crac (K)
results.creator_credit: Societe Radio-Canada, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Frederic Back
results.brief_description: Beautifully animated film which concerns itself with the lifestyle of people who lived in an age that is now past. A rocking chair, lovingly crafted from the trunk of a tall tree, is used as a linking device between generations, to show the cycle of life in a farming community in Quebec, Canada, in the nineteenth century to a museum of modern art in the twentieth century. Awards: Best animated short, Academy Awards 1981. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Crab fisherman
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the harmony of nature and man in a poignant work about man and the sea. Shows the dignity of men at work on a hard dangerous job as ancient as ships of wood.

results.title: CPR for citizens
results.brief_description: Basic techniques for emergency care of heart attack and choking victims, which allows the person at the scene of the attack to keep the heart pumping and the brain alive until help arrives. Identifies the principles of cardio-pulmonary resuscitation and explains its importance. Uses a mannequin and simple clear explanations for demonstrations. Commentary by Orson Welles.

results.title: Coyote ugly [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Jerry Bruckheimer, Chad Oman and David McNally
results.brief_description: Innocent New York newcomer Violet Sandford (Piper Perabo) needs a job to support herself while waiting for her big break as a songwriter, and hears about a nightly well paying position as a barmaid in a popular bar. ‘Coyote Ugly’ is run by Lil, a fast talking determined woman trying to succeed in a male dominated world. Her staff of beautiful women including tough Rachel and sweet Cammie, nightly pour drinks and entertain the bars mainly male clientele. In a world unlike the one she left behind, Violet struggles to keep her head above water, by day peddling her songs to anyone willing to listen, by night dancing on a bar as a ‘Coyote’, and in between developing her relationship with Kevin (Australian Adam Garcia). Cast includes John Goodman, Melanie Lynskey and model Tyra Banks.

results.title: Cowes Regatta
results.brief_description: Hundreds of craft assemble in the harbour at Cowes, to participate in the world famous regatta. From Cowes the film takes you to the Brittania Cup race, 1965, with the Duke of Edinburgh and Princess Anne competing in the royal yacht, Bloodhound.

results.title: Cowboy Bebop. Vol. 4
results.creator_credit: Sunrise Inc, Victor Entertainment, Bandai Visual Company, Masahiko Minami, Kazuhiko Ikeguchi and Shinichiro Watanabe
results.brief_description: This stylish and action packed Japanese anime television series is set in a 21st century dystopia where the earth is a wasteland and the solar system is besieged by a proliferation of gangsters. A motley group of bounty hunters who occupy a rickety ship, the ‘Bebop’, reluctantly band together. The group consists of Spike Siegel, a vicious fighter whose cynicism covers painful memories; Jet Black, a former policeman; Faye Valentine, a femme fatale and compulsive gambler; and Ed, a computer hacker girl. Session 15 “My funny Valentine” Faye tries to come to terms with the fact that she knows little about her past, prior to being cryogenically frozen. Session 16 “Black dog serenade” A riot on a prison ship unites Jet with an old cohort from his police days. When the criminal is the same one responsible for the loss of his arm, Jet seeks retribution. Session 17 “Mushroom samba” The Bebop is out of fuel, cash and food - consequently Ed takes on a bounty hunter mission, looking for a crooked magic mushroom dealer. Session 18 “Speak like a child” An anonymous package arrives for Faye, which leads to some clues about her mystifying past. “Cowboy Bebop” is an amusing cross-pollination between anime, the Western genre, classic Sci-fi flicks, and neo-noir with an anti-hero narrative overlayed with ultra cool aesthetics.

results.title: Cowboy Bebop. Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Sunrise Inc, Victor Entertainment, Bandai Visual Company, Masahiko Minami, Kazuhiko Ikeguchi and Shinichiro Watanabe
results.brief_description: This stylish and action packed Japanese anime television series is set in a 21st century dystopia - the earth is a wasteland and the solar system is besieged by a proliferation of gangsters. A motley group of bounty hunters, who ride aboard their rickety ship, the ‘Bebop’, reluctantly band together. The group consists of Spike Siegel, a vicious fighter whose cynicism covers painful memories; Jet Black, a former policeman; Faye Valentine, a femme fatale and compulsive gambler; and Ed, a computer hacker girl. Session 11 “Toys in the attic” When Jet is bitten by a mysterious organism, Spike and Ed are forced into the bowels of the Bebop to try to uncover the source and save their workmate. This episode has much in common with “Aliens” with a similar brand of black humour. Session 12 “Jupiter jazz (1)” Faye absconds with the Bebop loot and Jet wishes to retrieve her but Spike is more interested in tracking down Julia, his long-lost love - a quest which draws him into confrontation with arch-nemesis, Vicious. Session 13 “Jupiter jazz (2)” As Jet hunts for Faye and the missing money, Faye tries to uncover the secrets of the elusive Gren, a man/woman seeking vengeance. Session 14 “Bohemian rhapsody” After a series of robberies at the high tech toll booths that control interstellar travel, the Bebop crew are enlisted to track down the perpetrators. “Cowboy Bebop” is an amusing cross-pollination between anime, the Western, classic Sci-fi flicks, and neo-noir with an anti-hero narrative overlayed with ultra cool aesthetics.
